greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of distinct even prime indices of n.
comment: A prime index of n is a number m such that prime(m) divides n. The multiset of prime indices of n is row n of A112798.
If x and y are coprime then a(x*y) = a(x) + a(y). - _Robert Israel_, Mar 24 2019
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: G.f.: Sum_{k>=1} x^prime(2*k) / (1 - x^prime(2*k)). - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Feb 12 2020
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Mar 21 2019
